abstract: HSBC Holdings said the theft of Swiss client data at the heart of a recent tax dispute with France was vastly larger than it had previously acknowledged, involving at least 15,000 clients.
snippet: HSBC Holdings said the theft of Swiss client data at the heart of a recent tax dispute with France was vastly larger than it had previously acknowledged, involving at least 15,000 clients.
lead_paragraph: HSBC Holdings said the theft of Swiss client data at the heart of a recent tax dispute with France was vastly larger than it had previously acknowledged, involving at least 15,000 clients, David Jolly reported in The New York Times.

headline.main: HSBC Says 15,000 Hit by Swiss Data Case
